body: @markusweimer @tcNickolas Sorry, I'm a bit occupied by another task as of this moment, I'll get back to this once I have bandwidth. Thanks!
@jwang98052 can you rebase and resolve the conflicts? After that, I'll test and merge. Thanks!
I also left some comments on the JIRA. It seems unclear to me _what_ is being tested here.

@jwang98052 I am very confused by this pull request...what are we planning to do with this? 
For IMRU fault tolerance, we want driver to send message to task so that it fails while underlying context involving data remains intact, right? So we should not get IFailedEvaluator or IFailedContext message but just IFailedTask message. I am very confused.
@dkm2110 This is not for failed task but failed evaluator.  Failed task is separate scenario.
I see...ok..is there a JIRA for that?
@dkm2110 REEF-1307 is for failed task and resubmit task. .
@afchung @markusweimer @dkm2110 I have addressed the review comments.
@jwang98052 Let us split this in to two JIRAs. One for making default group creation passive and then another one for changes in IMRU. That way we are not stuck temporarily on REEF-1224.
@afchung Rebased.
@jwang98052 I have again left many high level comments...I am not checking finer level details since design may change substantially.
@markusweimer Could you take a look at this one? I've verified that it restores packages successfully on my machine and in AppVeyor

@dkm2110 Thanks for the review.

This PR is mainly for removing default group and decouple AllocatedEvaluator and AvtiveContext to preparing for the fault tolerant. More refining will be in separated JIRA. 

For the code organization, let's discuss offline. 

Please also review the design document and bring more comments before we even reach to code level.
@markusweimer rebased to the current master all functional tests passing on my end. DO you see the same failures with the recent @tcNickolas PR (for teh xunit consol runner)?
LGTM. Will merge.
I will test.
I followed the build and test instructions in `/lang/cs/BUILD.md`. They passed. Hence, I assume this is safe to merge.
@shulmanb Can you please rebase again? That way we get an appveyor result for this PR.

I will do a pass, focussing on high-level design feedback. A general note: design level stuff could be resolved before we have a PR over in JIRA.

Anything else failed, besides that? It doesn't have any of my changes. Will look into this.

Done with a pass. I believe this could be simplified in a couple of dimensions:
1. Remove changes to code other than INRU. None of the Examples are likely to gain fault tolerance anytime soon. And if they do, we can make that its own series of PRs.
2. Remove accidental changes like the renames to parameters to `.OnNext()` calls.
3. Most importantly: Move the logic for state keeping and gang scheduling into its own classes. Rx makes this sort of code very elegant. We could have a pipeline of Subjects that receive `ActiveContext` and `FailedContext` events. At the end of that pipeline, a collection of `ActiveContexts` pops out which is observed by another Subject that submits the tasks and changes the status of the IMRU Driver.

Stylistically, this adds a couple of places where `ArgumentException` is thrown in relation to collection entries. Are there more fine-grained exception classes from the .NET SDK we should use instead?

I confirmed that {{TcpConnectionRetryTest}} doesn't fail any more when executed from command line, and there are no new failures in VS. Functionality-wise I'm +1, didn't look at the code very closely.

Interesting, it's not enough to just delete bin folder + clean project to get new behavior, I also had to run java build separately to finally get rid of the firewall boxes. We might have something wrong with the way we clean .NET code. 

However, in the end I had a run with all tests pass and no firewall dialog boxes, so I'm ok with merging this.
OK, I will merge this :)
